channel.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
channel.description:
Ive installed ubuntu as a dual boot with wubi, but i cant connect to the internet.
Im using a linksys wrt54gs router.
if you need more info just ask.

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.source: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Alright well mopman has the pm, so i hope he will post them

And he said i needed a b43-wfcutter i think it was, but when i tried to install the package it said i already had it and now i dont know what to do…

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you posted them more than 1 person could help you, nothing from those commands is any type of security risk.

Read full topic

item.source: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Frell:

Like save them into a .txt on ubuntu, then go into the drive and get them?

Yes, but save them to your Windows partition (which Ubuntu should have automatically set up) so you can then reboot back into Windows and paste them here.

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:8, topic:215583”][quote author=Frell link=topic=283360.msg2299581#msg2299581 date=1214543886]

Type them in a terminal window in Ubuntu. Don’t worry about telling us your wireless card if you don’t know it, lspci should tell us anyway.

If you can’t be bothered to do that then… it does make me wonder why you expect anyone to bother helping you

Well before we get into things do you have to do alot of things to get the internet working?

Probably not - it depends what the problem is, but it might be a simple fix. I don’t really know unless you post the output of those commands

Alright ill write them down
[/quote]

Wow that’s going to take a while - can you not get to your windows partition from in Ubuntu, and save them to a txt file in that?[/quote]
Like save them into a .txt on ubuntu, then go into the drive and get them?

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:215583”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=283360.msg2299574#msg2299574 date=1214543765]

Type them in a terminal window in Ubuntu. Don’t worry about telling us your wireless card if you don’t know it, lspci should tell us anyway.

If you can’t be bothered to do that then… it does make me wonder why you expect anyone to bother helping you

Well before we get into things do you have to do alot of things to get the internet working?

Probably not - it depends what the problem is, but it might be a simple fix. I don’t really know unless you post the output of those commands
[/quote]
Alright ill write them down :P[/quote]

Wow that’s going to take a while - can you not get to your windows partition from in Ubuntu, and save them to a txt file in that?

Read full topic

item.source: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:215583”]Which wireless card are you using? The router dosen’t matter.

Also please post the output of lspci | grep ethernet, iwlist scan and ifconfig. (Without the quotes - that’s 3 seperate commands)[/quote]
Are those commands for windows or ubuntu? If ubuntu i really dont want to go back and forth between OSs,

and i have no clue how to find out my wireless card

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help

item.title: Connecting to a wireless internet with ubuntu... help
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Which wireless card are you using? The router dosen’t matter.

Also please post the output of lspci | grep ethernet, iwlist scan and ifconfig. (Without the quotes - that’s 3 seperate commands)

Read full topic
